perturbation.original_text: 6. The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne by equally by the parties. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne equally by the parties. In certain circumstances, the mediation may be binding, as determined by the franchisor. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that mediation is non-binding. The modified text introduces a contradiction by stating that in certain circumstances it can be binding at the franchisor's discretion, creating uncertainty about the nature of the mediation process.

perturbation.original_text: 8. You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code 20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.changed_text: 8. You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. While California Corporation Code 31512 and Business and Professions Code 20010 may void a waiver of some rights, the franchisor's interpretation of these laws will be considered final and binding.
perturbation.explanation: The original text acknowledges that California law voids waivers of certain rights. The modified text then contradicts this by asserting that the franchisor's interpretation of these laws will be final and binding. This introduces uncertainty about whether the franchisee's rights are truly protected under California law, or if the franchisor can override these protections.

perturbation.original_text: 1. California Business and Professions Code Sections 20000 through 20043 provide rights to you concerning termination or non-renewal of a franchise. If the Master Franchise Agreement contains provisions that are inconsistent with the law, the law will control.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. California Business and Professions Code Sections 20000 through 20043 may provide rights to you concerning termination or non-renewal of a franchise. Even if the Master Franchise Agreement contains provisions that are inconsistent with the law, the Master Franchise Agreement shall govern all dispute resolution.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that California law will control if it conflicts with the Master Franchise Agreement. The changed text directly contradicts this by stating the Master Franchise Agreement shall govern all dispute resolution, even if it violates the law. This creates significant uncertainty about the franchisee's rights and the enforceability of the agreement.
